commitResults.messageBody: I renamed my bot to "Rei"
Customized Rei bot
Updated Rei to return list of tasks
Updated rei to mark tasks as done/not done. Rei can also handle task numbers beyond limit (ask user to reinput the correct task number)
Made ToDo, Deadline, and Event inner classes of Task class.
Make testcases and desired outputs
Handle errors for unknown keywords and user not specifying details
Allow user to delete task. Use ArrayList to store the tasks.
Allow rei bot to store tasks in a database.
Allow rei bot to take and use date-time format.
Extract Parser, Storage, TaskList and Ui from Rei
Make JUnit testcases for TaskList and Task
Package Rei bot into JAR file using Gradle shadowJar
Add method in TaskList that returns the storing format
Add enums in parser for better abstraction
Delete Ui instance in Rei
Add JavaDoc to all classes
Add find method using a keyword
Delete the part where a parameter's value is changed
Save the tasks directly (does not wait for an exit command)

Create GUI for REI using FXML

Modify the methods to support the GUI

Standardize error handling with ReiException and remove unused code

The project still contains some non-GUI error handling which doesn't fit
well with the current GUI-based structure. There are also several unused
methods in TaskList and unused fields across the codebase. Additionally,
the Ui.java class has become obsolete since the transition to a full GUI
interface.

Non-GUI error handling fragments the code and leads to inconsistent
behavior in certain parts of the application. Unused code increases
complexity and can cause confusion for developers.

Let's replace all non-GUI error handling with ReiException to
standardize how exceptions are handled. This will ensure consistent
error reporting within the GUI.

Let's also clean up the codebase by removing unused methods from
TaskList and other unused fields. These removals will reduce technical
debt and improve maintainability.

Finally, we'll delete Ui.java as it is no longer required due to the
complete shift to GUI-based user interaction. This cleans up the codebase
further and reflects the current architecture of the project.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update javadocs for TaskList message changes
commitResults.messageBody:
The current javadocs are outdated and do not describe the changes
made to the TaskList methods, which now generate messages upon
executing commands.

This needs to change because the javadocs should accurately
document the behavior of the methods, especially to ensure clarity
for future contributors and maintainers.

Update the javadocs to describe the message generation after
command execution.

This is done to keep the documentation aligned with the current
implementation, making it easier to understand the methods'
functionality.

No functional code changes have been madeâ€”this commit strictly
updates the documentation.
Add assertion in the defauls case of the enum switch-case

The current codebase has sections that do not adhere to the
SLAP, making it harder to read and maintain.

This needs to change to improve code readability and ensure
a cleaner structure by keeping each method focused
on a single level of abstraction.

Extract the lines of code that violate SLAP into separate methods.

Tested the code to verify that it still works the same after the
refactor.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix: correct delete command to handle task index properly
commitResults.messageBody:
The delete command was not functioning as expected due to the
taskIndex being incorrectly parsed. The input was not trimmed,
leading to errors when extracting the number from the prompt.

This fix trims the input before passing it to `parseInt`, ensuring
the correct task index is extracted.

This resolves the issue, allowing the delete command to work
as intended.
Add an assertion
Sync branch-A-CodeQuality with the latest master
Add proper credit to the author who inspired this piece of idea
Improve Code Quality by Fixing SLAP

- add ability to assign a tag or a list of tags to a Task
- implement functionality to load and save tags

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor storage system: switch from Path to File to resolve loading issues
commitResults.messageBody:
The storage system currently uses Path for file
handling, which fails when loading new files.

This needs to change because the failure to load new files indicates
compatibility issues and limitations in file operations.

Adapted from github.com/adipanda2002/ip .
